ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I had never used oil paint as a medium before, and I was able to learn how to use it in this class.
I learned the basics of oil painting and general composition, as well as how to prepare surfaces for painting.

We developed so many skills in this class: how to put together your own canvas, mixing oil paints to create the correct color, finding a good composition, how to properly gesso a canvas, how to give and receive feedback on art (without saying "I like..."), etc. 

It was wonderful seeing everyone improve so much as the semester progressed

My oil painting skills vastly increased throughout this course. It was a great introduction to all different palettes, from black and white to full spectrum. We painted a vast survey of still lifes, portraits and creative imaginative pieces.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: you get to learn by practicing--we never really learned any theory
Weaknesses: sometime the theory was necessary for our understanding of paint
The strength of this course was in the competitive environment, it fostered accountability, however a weakness is that it got super stressful. Another strength was the feedback.

This course was very challenging, but also fun. The small class size allowed for great relationships to be formed between classmates, and formal critiques encouraged everyone to be engaged with their peers' work. The class was a disorganized, so it wasn't always clear when assignments were due which made it hard to balance the coursework with other work (before midterms and finals the necessary time commitment was very high).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend taking this class if you are interested in painting and are committed to putting in the effort this class requires.

Yes, if you have time in your schedule for studio time and out of class work. I spent at least a few hours every weekend painting on top of class time. I was intimidated to take this course, but I definitely recommend to anyone considering it!

I would recommend this course to someone who has time to put into their paintings. Though the class doesn't work the same academic muscle as many others, it takes time to produce a good painting. Be prepared to spend a lot of hours outside of class in the school of art!
Yes I would, go learn to paint, its fun.

Everyone should take this class if you want to become a better painter. It makes you think in a different way than most other Yale courses, and you come out of it with a full portfolio of work that you can be proud of.
